annotation.spannedText: that the "influenza vaccine is the most effective preventive measure available"

classMention.mentionClass: that the "influenza vaccine is the most effective preventive measure available"

annotation.spannedText: "Vaccination and the use of antiviral drugs are two of the most important response measures for reducing morbidity and mortality during a pandemic."

classMention.mentionClass: "Vaccination and the use of antiviral drugs are two of the most important response measures for reducing morbidity and mortality during a pandemic."

annotation.spannedText: Today, thanks to the advances of molecular technology, we are on the verge of making influenza vaccines through the genetic manipulation of influenza genes

classMention.mentionClass: Today, thanks to the advances of molecular technology, we are on the verge of making influenza vaccines through the genetic manipulation of influenza genes

annotation.spannedText: the anticipated circulating strains for the coming season

classMention.mentionClass: the anticipated circulating strains for the coming season

annotation.spannedText: Split and subunit vaccines cause fewer local reactions than whole virus vaccines, and a single dose produces adequate antibody levels in a population exposed to similar viruses

classMention.mentionClass: Split and subunit vaccines cause fewer local reactions than whole virus vaccines, and a single dose produces adequate antibody levels in a population exposed to similar viruses

annotation.spannedText: The adaptation process ... to have caused stable mutations in the three polymerase genes of the virus, namely PA, PB1, and PB2

classMention.mentionClass: The adaptation process ... to have caused stable mutations in the three polymerase genes of the virus, namely PA, PB1, and PB2

annotation.spannedText: The advantages of a live virus vaccine applied to the nasal mucosa are the development of local neutralising immunity, the development of a cell-mediated immune response, and a cross-reactive and longer lasting immune response

classMention.mentionClass: The advantages of a live virus vaccine applied to the nasal mucosa are the development of local neutralising immunity, the development of a cell-mediated immune response, and a cross-reactive and longer lasting immune response

annotation.spannedText: A vaccine using the outer membrane proteins of Neisseria meningitidis as an adjuvant has shown success in early clinical trials

classMention.mentionClass: A vaccine using the outer membrane proteins of Neisseria meningitidis as an adjuvant has shown success in early clinical trials

annotation.spannedText: An infection with a NS1-deficient virus would quickly be overcome by the immune system, hopefully resulting in an immune response, but with no symptoms

classMention.mentionClass: An infection with a NS1-deficient virus would quickly be overcome by the immune system, hopefully resulting in an immune response, but with no symptoms

annotation.spannedText: a study by Gurfinkel et al. (2004)

classMention.mentionClass: a study by Gurfinkel et al. (2004)

annotation.spannedText: a reduction in the one year risk of death (6 % in the vaccinated group, 13 % in the control group) and combination of death, repeat MI, or rehospitalisation (22 % versus 37 %), possibly due to a non-specific effect of immune responsiveness

classMention.mentionClass: a reduction in the one year risk of death (6 % in the vaccinated group, 13 % in the control group) and combination of death, repeat MI, or rehospitalisation (22 % versus 37 %), possibly due to a non-specific effect of immune responsiveness

annotation.spannedText: that, while individual health benefits from vaccination certainly exist, as do reductions in days absent from work, vaccinating healthy working adults may not provide cost savings when compared to loss of productivity and days taken off due to illness

classMention.mentionClass: that, while individual health benefits from vaccination certainly exist, as do reductions in days absent from work, vaccinating healthy working adults may not provide cost savings when compared to loss of productivity and days taken off due to illness

annotation.spannedText: that hospital employees tend to report to work in spite of having an acute febrile illness

annotation.spannedText: that vaccinating health care professionals reduces nursing home and hospital-acquired influenza infections

annotation.spannedText: to start developing new vaccines based on strains that may be related to an eventual pandemic strain

annotation.spannedText: "What if the pandemic were to start "

classMention.mentionClass: "What if the pandemic were to start "

annotation.spannedText: that it could handle the distribution and administration of the vaccines

classMention.mentionClass: that it could handle the distribution and administration of the vaccines

annotation.spannedText: "Our goal should be to develop a new cell culture-based vaccine that includes antigens that are present in all subtypes of influenza virus, that do not change from year to year, and that can be made available to the entire world population. We need an international approach to public funding that will pay for the excess production capacity required during a pandemic."

classMention.mentionClass: "Our goal should be to develop a new cell culture-based vaccine that includes antigens that are present in all subtypes of influenza virus, that do not change from year to year, and that can be made available to the entire world population. We need an international approach to public funding that will pay for the excess production capacity required during a pandemic."

annotation.spannedText: that cell culture, using Madin-Darby Canine Kidney (MDCK) or Vero (African green monkey kidney) cells approved for human vaccine production, may eventually replace the use of hens' eggs

classMention.mentionClass: that cell culture, using Madin-Darby Canine Kidney (MDCK) or Vero (African green monkey kidney) cells approved for human vaccine production, may eventually replace the use of hens' eggs

annotation.spannedText: that, by producing immunity to conserved proteins, i.e. proteins that do not undergo antigenic change like HA and NA do, a vaccine can be produced that does not need to be "reinvented" each year
